intro: Asyneuma limonifolium subsp. pestalozzae, commonly known as the lemon-leaf asyneuma, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically yellow or orange, arranged in clustered inflorescences. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments.
